New Records: The Dodgers' NL record for one postseason was 33 consecutive scoreless innings, tying the postseason record of the 1966 Orioles.
Key Match Events: Mets' pitcher Kodai Senga was off his game, throwing 30 pitches, 20 of which were balls, and only 7 ¹/₃ innings on his 2024 docket coming in.
The Mets' lineup stopped, gathering only two hits off Dodgers starter Jack Flaherty.
The Dodgers' bullpen was not needed, with Flaherty pitching seven scoreless innings.
The Mets were left off the invite list in their 9-0 defeat, a forfeit score that fit their performance.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were expected to hold a major rotation advantage with the majority of Dodgers starters currently on the injured list.
The Yankees backed away from a potential trade for Flaherty due to concerns about his lower back.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said Senga was 'off' and didn't have it.
Iglesias said 'It's just baseball, we are going to come back tomorrow with the best energy and continue to compete.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets are stepping up in class now, facing a lineup with an unmatched trio of stars and finishing games with a fairly airtight bullpen.
The Mets specialize in comebacks and have a seven-game series to showcase their resilience.
Others: The game was a party, with Mets fans serenading owner Steve Cohen before the game, and later chanting 'Fredd-ie, Fredd-ie' and 'M-V-P'.
